issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The Node controller will keep crashing if configured for MANAGED-NOVLAN mode on RHEL6. The stack trace from GDB and log info are:


Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007fc337f3857c in vfprintf () from /lib64/libc.so.6
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007fc337f3857c in vfprintf () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007fc331c27cd2 in logprintfl () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#2  0x00007fc331c168f9 in vnetInit () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#3  0x00007fc331bf93da in ?? () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#4  0x00007fc331bfa78c in doDescribeResource () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#5  0x00007fc331befada in ncDescribeResourceMarshal () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#6  0x00007fc331bead14 in axis2_skel_EucalyptusNC_ncDescribeResource () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#7  0x00007fc331bec3fe in axis2_svc_skel_EucalyptusNC_invoke () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#8  0x00007fc337434c35 in ?? () from /usr/lib64/libaxis2_engine.so.0
#9  0x00007fc3374347a1 in ?? () from /usr/lib64/libaxis2_engine.so.0
#10 0x00007fc33742ad16 in axis2_engine_receive () from /usr/lib64/libaxis2_engine.so.0
#11 0x00007fc337682367 in axis2_http_transport_utils_process_http_post_request () from /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/libmod_axis2.so
#12 0x00007fc33767dd3c in axis2_apache2_worker_process_request () from /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/libmod_axis2.so
#13 0x00007fc33767bf7c in ?? () from /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/libmod_axis2.so
#14 0x00007fc3399dcb00 in ap_run_handler ()
#15 0x00007fc3399e03be in ap_invoke_handler ()
#16 0x00007fc3399eba30 in ap_process_request ()
#17 0x00007fc3399e88f8 in ?? ()
#18 0x00007fc3399e4608 in ap_run_process_connection ()
#19 0x00007fc3399f0807 in ?? ()
#20 0x00007fc3399f0b1a in ?? ()
#21 0x00007fc3399f179c in ap_mpm_run ()
#22 0x00007fc3399c8900 in main ()



[root@eucahost-51-90 eucalyptus]#  tail -F httpd-nc_error_log &
[root@eucahost-51-90 eucalyptus]#  tail -F nc.log &
[root@eucahost-51-90 eucalyptus]#  tail -F axis2c.log &
[root@eucahost-51-90 eucalyptus]#  tail -F euca_test_nc.log &

[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012] [error] error.c(94) OXS ERROR [x509.c:287 in openssl_x509_get_subject_key_identifier] oxs defualt error , The extenension index of NID_subject_key_identifier is not valid
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012] [error] error.c(94) OXS ERROR [x509.c:287 in openssl_x509_get_subject_key_identifier] oxs defualt error , The extenension index of NID_subject_key_identifier is not valid
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012] [error] error.c(94) OXS ERROR [x509.c:287 in openssl_x509_get_subject_key_identifier] oxs defualt error , The extenension index of NID_subject_key_identifier is not valid
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] Eucalyptus node controller initializing [built 2012-05-16 19:52:51-04:00]
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] NC is looking for configuration in //etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf,//etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.local.conf
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] using hooks directory //etc/eucalyptus/nc-hooks
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] euca_init_cert(): using file //var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/node-cert.pem
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] euca_init_cert(): using file //var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/node-pk.pem
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] found grub 1 stage files in /boot/grub
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] physical memory available for instances: 7793MB
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] virtual cpu cores available for instances: 4
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] initializing backing store...
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] disk space for instances: /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]                           280581MB limit (30.3% of the file system) - 5480MB overhead = 275101MB = 268GB
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]                           000000MB reserved for use (0.0% of limit)
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]                           000000MB allocated for use (0.0% of limit, 0.0% of the file system)
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]     disk space for cache: /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]                           569666MB limit (61.5% of the file system)
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]                           000000MB reserved for use (0.0% of limit)
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ]                           000000MB allocated for use (0.0% of limit, 0.0% of the file system)
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] looking for existing domains
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012][017765][EUCAINFO  ] no currently running domains to adopt
[Thu May 17 14:15:46 2012] [error] server reached MaxClients setting, consider raising the MaxClients setting


The stack trace points to line 162 in net/vnetwork.c where logprintfl() is called with a formatted string expecting a string parameter that is not provided:


logprintfl (EUCAERROR, "vnetInit(): cannot verify VNET_BRIDGE(%s), please check parameters and 
         bridge device\n");

Solution would be:

logprintfl (EUCAERROR, "vnetInit(): cannot verify VNET_BRIDGE(%s), please check parameters and 
         bridge device\n", SP(bridgedev));
fields.summary: NC crash on startup when configured for MANAGED-NOVLAN

comments.body: Reduced to a Critical since this was related to a mis-configuration.

Fixed. Issue was occured because of a mis-configured (not configured) bridge device which should not occur at customer. The crash happened because a printf() style call did not have a valid parameter list. Fix has been checked in.

worklogs.comment: Fixed. Issue was occured because of a mis-configured (not configured) bridge device which should not occur at customer. The crash happened because a printf() style call did not have a valid parameter list. Fix has been checked in.
